document.heading: Police Truancy Enforcement Amendment Act of 1994

history.narrative: Law 10-159, the “Police Truancy Enforcement Amendment Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-248, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 7, 1994, and June 21, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 8, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-275 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-159 became effective on August 25, 1995.
